how i stop the xorg on ubuntu 12.04: Why aren't you using the Additional Drivers utility to install the Nvidia drivers?
The correct way to install Nvidia drivers in Ubuntu is to use the "Additional Drivers" utility, which you can get to by searching for "drivers" in the Unity search bar.

Nvidia Optimus isn't very well supported currently (Nvidia doesn't officially support it on GNU/Linux at all, though there are third party tools to get it working).
You're welcome. Note though that I haven't personally worked with Optimus configurations, or verified the soundness of those directions.
